amendment.description: Amendment states that the use of child soldiers is unacceptable as well as a violation of human rights and that the prevention and elimination of child soldiers should be a foreign policy goal of the United States.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 25 printed in Part C of House Report 111-143 that the use of child soldiers is unacceptable and is a violation of human rights and the prevention and elimination of child soldiers should be a foreign policy goal of the United States.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Johnson, E. B. amendment (A024) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Amendment (A024) offered by Ms. Johnson, E. B..
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Johnson, E. B. amendment (A024) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
